results.title: Enhancement of EPC migration by high-dose lisinopril is superior compared to captopril and ramipril
results.text_hl: Meanwhile, high-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (100mM) had the highest migration effect, suggesting it may be preferable for promoting EPC migration in @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@CAD@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Oktaviono YH, Ahmad HA, Al Farabi MJ, Gandi P, Givani CL, Lumeno ISP, Azmi Y. Enhancement of EPC migration by high-dose lisinopril is superior compared to captopril and ramipril F1000Res. 2021;10():15. PMID: 34707860

results.title: The ACE-inhibitor lisinopril affects plasma insulin levels but not fibrinolytic parameters.
results.text_hl: Therefore the present study examines the relationship between @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ and @GENE_SERPINE1 @GENE_5054 @@@PAI-1@@@ plasma levels during intravenous @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ tolerance tests before and after administration with the @GENE_AP2B1 @GENE_163 @@@ACE@@@-inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ in 12 male @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with angiographically proven @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@ and borderline @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@.

results.title: Cardioreparative effects of lisinopril in rats with genetic hypertension and left ventricular hypertrophy.
results.text_hl: Cardioreparative effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ with genetic @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertrophy_Left_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017379 @@@left ventricular hypertrophy@@@.

results.title: Angiotensin II receptor binding following myocardial infarction in the rat.
results.text_hl: Five groups were studied: age and sex matched controls receiving this operative procedure without subsequent @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ (sham operated); @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery@@@ ligation and @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@; @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery@@@ ligation and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (20 mg.kg-1.d-1 in drinking water); sham operated @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@; and unoperated @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ which served as controls to pericardiotomy.

citations.NLM: Sun Y, Weber KT. Angiotensin II receptor binding following myocardial infarction in the rat. Cardiovasc Res. 1994 Nov;28(11):1623-8. PMID: 7842454
citations.BibTeX: @article{7842454, title={Angiotensin II receptor binding following myocardial infarction in the rat.}, author={Sun Y and Weber KT}, journal={Cardiovasc Res}, volume={28}, number={11}, pages={1623-8}}

results.title: Prevention of structural changes in the heart in hypertension by angiotensin converting enzyme inhibition.
results.text_hl: In established genetic @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, sustained treatment with high-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ normalizes the blood pressure, reverses @DISEASE_Hypertrophy_Left_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017379 @@@left ventricular hypertrophy@@@, reverses excessive interstitial and perivascular @DISEASE_Fibrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@fibrosis@@@ (and consequently the impaired compliance), and reverses excessive @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery medial thickening@@@ (thereby normalizing coronary vascular reserve).

citations.NLM: Tan LB, Brilla C, Weber KT. Prevention of structural changes in the heart in hypertension by angiotensin converting enzyme inhibition. J Hypertens Suppl. 1992 Apr;10(1):S31-4. PMID: 1535655
citations.BibTeX: @article{1535655, title={Prevention of structural changes in the heart in hypertension by angiotensin converting enzyme inhibition.}, author={Tan LB and Brilla C and Weber KT}, journal={J Hypertens Suppl}, volume={10}, number={1}, pages={S31-4}}

results.title: Response of large and small vessels to alpha and beta adrenoceptor stimulation in heart failure: effect of angiotensin converting enzyme inhibition.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_10116 @@@Rats@@@ with @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@CHF@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery ligation@@@) were treated with placebo or the @GENE_ACE @GENE_24310 @@@ACE@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (10 mg/kg/d) starting 7 days after ligation.

results.title: Glucose Monitoring Dermopathy.
results.text_hl: His medical history was remarkable for @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes mellitus@@@, @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@, and a pacemaker.

results.title: Long-term morbidity and mortality trials with amlodipine.
results.text_hl: The ALLHAT trial compares the effects of standard diuretic treatment with three alternative treatments (@CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Doxazosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017292 @@@doxazosin@@@) on the incidence of fatal @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@CAD@@@) and nonfatal @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ (MI) in 40,000 @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Oparil S. Long-term morbidity and mortality trials with amlodipine. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1999;33 Suppl 2():S1-6. PMID: 10071256
citations.BibTeX: @article{10071256, title={Long-term morbidity and mortality trials with amlodipine.}, author={Oparil S}, journal={J Cardiovasc Pharmacol}, volume={33 Suppl 2}, pages={S1-6}}

results.title: [Calcium antagonists in cardiovascular disease. Clinical evidence from morbidity and mortality trials].
results.text_hl: The Antihypertensive and @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@Lipid@@@-Lowering Treatment to Prevent @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@Heart Attack@@@ Trial (ALLHAT) compares the effects of standard diuretic treatment with 3 alternatives (@CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Doxazosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017292 @@@doxazosin@@@) on the incidence of fatal @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@ and nonfatal @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ in more than 42,000 @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with additional cardiovascular risk factors.

citations.NLM: Oparil S, Bakir SE. [Calcium antagonists in cardiovascular disease. Clinical evidence from morbidity and mortality trials]. Drugs. 2000;59 Spec No 2():25-37. PMID: 11002856
citations.BibTeX: @article{11002856, title={[Calcium antagonists in cardiovascular disease. Clinical evidence from morbidity and mortality trials].}, author={Oparil S and Bakir SE}, journal={Drugs}, volume={59 Spec No 2}, pages={25-37}}
